      • accountId

        public java.lang.String accountId()
        Gets the accountId. The ID of the billing account to list the tags for. If it is not set, then it is taken from the authorization token. This parameter is required if `tag_type` is set to `service`.
        Returns:
        the accountId

      • tagType

        public java.lang.String tagType()
        Gets the tagType. The type of the tag you want to list. Supported values are `user`, `service` and `access`.
        Returns:
        the tagType

      • fullData

        public java.lang.Boolean fullData()
        Gets the fullData. If set to `true`, this query returns the provider, `ghost`, `ims` or `ghost,ims`, where the tag exists and the number of attached resources.
        Returns:
        the fullData

      • providers

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> providers()
        Gets the providers. Select a provider. Supported values are `ghost` and `ims`. To list both Global Search and Tagging tags and infrastructure tags, use `ghost,ims`. `service` and `access` tags can only be attached to resources that are onboarded to Global Search and Tagging, so you should not set this parameter when listing them.
        Returns:
        the providers

      • attachedTo

        public java.lang.String attachedTo()
        Gets the attachedTo. If you want to return only the list of tags attached to a specified resource, pass the ID of the resource on this parameter. For resources that are onboarded to Global Search and Tagging, the resource ID is the CRN; for IMS resources, it is the IMS ID. When using this parameter, you must specify the appropriate provider (`ims` or `ghost`).
        Returns:
        the attachedTo

      • offset

        public java.lang.Long offset()
        Gets the offset. The offset is the index of the item from which you want to start returning data from.
        Returns:
        the offset

      • limit

        public java.lang.Long limit()
        Gets the limit. The number of tags to return.
        Returns:
        the limit

      • timeout

        public java.lang.Long timeout()
        Gets the timeout. The search timeout bounds the search request to be executed within the specified time value. It returns the hits accumulated until time runs out.
        Returns:
        the timeout

      • orderByName

        public java.lang.String orderByName()
        Gets the orderByName. Order the output by tag name.
        Returns:
        the orderByName

      • attachedOnly

        public java.lang.Boolean attachedOnly()
        Gets the attachedOnly. Filter on attached tags. If `true`, it returns only tags that are attached to one or more resources. If `false`, it returns all tags.
        Returns:
        the attachedOnly
